intro: Palaua sandemanii, commonly known as the sandemanii palaua, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Palau in the Western Pacific. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palm-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in coastal and wetland habitats, often growing in brackish or saltwater environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
